Job Title: QAD Support Analyst

Location: Shreveport-Bossier City Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Position Summary:We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated QAD Support Specialist to join our team. The QAD Support Specialist will be responsible for providing technical support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of the QAD enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of QAD applications and modules, excellent problem-solving abilities, and strong communication skills to interact effectively with end-users and stakeholders.
The QAD Support Specialist provides IT Tech support for QAD EE suite of applications used for manufacturing operations. Experience in QAD Enterprise Edition, support and help desk projects.
Must have experience in Progress4GL and working experience in progress code development from scratch, data migration process and QAD tools like CIM for Data migration activities. Should be able to do independent code testing, system testing, end user support against day-to-day issues, support users for user testing, support, root cause analysis. QAD Browse creation and QRF Reporting. 
Able to work and support multi-applications and other ERP interfaces.
QAD eB2 support, maintenance, and enhancement projects Assist in upgrading to QAD AE/AUX environment Day to day QAD EE2018 systems and operational supportDeep understanding of business practices; possess adequate knowledge of databases, system security, and troubleshooting.Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to explain technical issues to technical and non-technical staff.Knowledge of software development processes and best practices.Provide regular on-hour and off hours support to QAD 2018EE applications.Monitor queue of user’s incidents and requestDefine workarounds and containment actions to specific problems identified during support activities.Carry out root cause analysis of issues / defects reported by plant users.Review and analyze statement of requirements and prepare functional specifications that will provide solution to business problem.Design and propose new functionality for system module enhancements or break fix.Participate on code change.Lead small implementation projects to implement system changes, new system or enhancements to already existing systems.Provide training on QAD enhancements, break fixes and new functionality to users.Work with end-users and QAD Consultants
QualificationsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.Proven experience working with QAD ERP system, including modules such as Manufacturing, Distribution, Finance, and Supply Chain.Strong technical skills, including proficiency in QAD programming languages (e.g., Progress 4GL), SQL, and database management.Experience with QAD system administration tasks such as user management, security configurations, and system integrations.Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex issues and implement effective solutions.Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact professionally with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment with a customer-focused mindset.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
